intro: Euphrasia mollis, commonly known as the soft bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, yellowish flowers with two lips, typical of the genus Euphrasia. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its common name.
